   21: %%
   22: %% Tests of diameter_tcp/sctp as implementations of the diameter
   23: %% transport interface.
   24: %%
   25: 
   26: -module(diameter_transport_SUITE).
   27: 
   28: %% all tests, no common_test dependency
   29: -export([run/0]).
   30: 
   31: %% common_test wrapping
   32: -export([
   33:          %% Framework functions
   34:          suite/0,
   35:          all/0,
   36:          init_per_suite/1,
   37:          end_per_suite/1,
   38:         
   39:          %% The test cases
   40:          parallel/1
   41:         ]).
   42: 
   43: -export([accept/1,
   44:          connect/1,
   45:          reconnect/1,
   46:          init/2]).
   47: 
   48: -include_lib("kernel/include/inet_sctp.hrl").
   49: -include_lib("diameter/include/diameter.hrl").
   50: 
   51: -include("diameter_util.hrl").
   52: 
   53: %% Corresponding to diameter_* transport modules.
   54: -define(TRANSPORTS, [tcp, sctp]).
   55: 
   56: %% Receive a message.
   57: -define(RECV(Pat, Ret), receive Pat -> Ret end).
   58: -define(RECV(Pat), ?RECV(Pat, diameter_lib:now())).
   59: 
   60: %% Sockets are opened on the loopback address.
   61: -define(ADDR, {127,0,0,1}).
   62: 
   63: %% diameter_tcp doesn't use anything but host_ip_address, and that
   64: %% only is a local address isn't configured as at transport start.
   65: -define(SVC(Addrs), #diameter_service{capabilities
   66:                                       = #diameter_caps{host_ip_address
   67:                                                        = Addrs}}).
   68: 
   69: %% The term we register after open a listening port with gen_{tcp,sctp}.
   70: -define(TEST_LISTENER(Ref, PortNr),
   71:         {?MODULE, listen, Ref, PortNr}).
   72: 
   73: %% Message over the transport interface.
   74: -define(TMSG(T), {diameter, T}).
   75: 
   76: %% Options for gen_tcp/gen_sctp.
   77: -define(TCP_OPTS,  [binary, {active, true}, {packet, 0}]).
   78: -define(SCTP_OPTS, [binary, {active, true}, {sctp_initmsg, ?SCTP_INIT}]).
   79: 
   80: %% Request a specific number of streams just because we can.
   81: -define(SCTP_INIT, #sctp_initmsg{num_ostreams = 5,
   82:                                  max_instreams = 5}).
   83: 
   84: %% Messages from gen_sctp.
   85: -define(SCTP(Sock, Data), {sctp, Sock, _, _, Data}).
   86: 
   87: 
   88: -define(TL(F),    ?TL(F, [])).
   89: -define(TL(F, A), ?LOG("DTRANSPS", F, A)).
   90: 
   91: 
   92: %% ===========================================================================
   93: %% common_test wrapping
   94: 
   95: suite() ->
   96:     [{timetrap, {seconds, 270}}].
   97: 
   98: all() ->
   99:     [parallel].
  100: 
  101: 
  102: init_per_suite(Config) ->
  103:     ?DUTIL:init_per_suite(Config).
  104: 
  105: end_per_suite(Config) ->
  106:     ?DUTIL:end_per_suite(Config).
  107: 
  108: 
  109: parallel(_) ->
  110:     ?TL("parallel -> entry"),
  111:     Res = run(),
  112:     ?TL("parallel -> done when"
  113:         "~n   Res: ~p", [Res]),
  114:     Res.
  115: 
  116: 
  117: %% ===========================================================================
  118: 
  119: %% run/0
  120: 
  121: run() ->
  122:     ok = diameter:start(),
  123:     try
  124:         ?RUN([[fun run/1, {P,F}]
  125:               || P <- [sctp || ?HAVE_SCTP()] ++ [tcp],
  126:                  F <- [connect, accept, reconnect]])
  127:     after
  128:         diameter:stop()
  129:     end.
  130: 
  131: %% run/1
  132: 
  133: run({Prot, reconnect}) ->
  134:     ?TL("run(reconnect) -> entry with"
  135:         "~n   Prot: ~p", [Prot]),
  136:     Res = reconnect(Prot),
  137:     ?TL("run(reconnect) -> done when"
  138:         "~n   Res: ~p", [Res]),
  139:     Res;
  140: 
  141: run({Prot, accept}) ->
  142:     ?TL("run(accept) -> entry with"
  143:         "~n   Prot: ~p", [Prot]),
  144:     Res = accept(Prot),
  145:     ?TL("run(accept) -> done when"
  146:         "~n   Res: ~p", [Res]),
  147:     Res;
  148: 
  149: run({Prot, connect}) ->
  150:     ?TL("run(connect) -> entry with"
  151:         "~n   Prot: ~p", [Prot]),
  152:     Res = connect(Prot),
  153:     ?TL("run(connect) -> done when"
  154:         "~n   Res: ~p", [Res]),
  155:     Res.
  156: 
  157: 
  158: %% ===========================================================================
  159: %% accept/1
  160: %%
  161: %% diameter transport accepting, test code connecting.
  162: 
  163: accept(Prot) ->
  164:     ?TL("accept -> entry with"
  165:         "~n   Prot: ~p", [Prot]),
  166: 
  167:     Ref = make_ref(),
  168:     true = diameter_reg:add_new({diameter_config, transport, Ref}), %% fake it
  169:     T = {Prot, Ref},
  170:     Res = ?RUN([{{?MODULE, [init, X, T]}, 15000}
  171:                 || X <- [accept, gen_connect]]),
  172: 
  173:     ?TL("accept -> done when"
  174:         "~n   Res: ~p", [Res]),
  175:     ok.
  176: 
  177: 
  178: %% ===========================================================================
  179: %% connect/1
  180: %%
  181: %% Test code accepting, diameter transport connecting.
  182: 
  183: connect(Prot) ->
  184:     ?TL("connect -> entry with"
  185:         "~n   Prot: ~p", [Prot]),
  186: 
  187:     T = {Prot, make_ref()},
  188:     Res = ?RUN([{{?MODULE, [init, X, T]}, 15000}
  189:                  || X <- [gen_accept, connect]]),
  190: 
  191:     ?TL("connect -> done when"
  192:         "~n   Res: ~p", [Res]),
  193:     ok.
  194: 
  195: 
  196: %% ===========================================================================
  197: %% reconnect/1
  198: %%
  199: %% Exercise reconnection behaviour: that a connecting transport
  200: %% doesn't try to establish a new connection until the old one is
  201: %% broken.
  202: 
  203: reconnect({listen, Ref}) ->
  204:     ?TL("reconnect(listen) -> entry with"
  205:         "~n   Ref: ~p", [Ref]),
  206:     SvcName = make_ref(),
  207:     ?TL("reconnect(listen) -> start event logger"),
  208:     Logger = ?DEL_START("reconnect(listen)", SvcName),
  209:     ?TL("reconnect(listen) -> start service (~p)", [SvcName]),
  210:     ok = start_service(SvcName),
  211:     ?TL("reconnect(listen) -> connect"),
  212:     LRef = ?LISTEN(SvcName, tcp, [{watchdog_timer, 6000}]),
  213:     ?TL("reconnect(listen) -> wait"),
  214:     [_] = diameter_reg:wait({diameter_tcp, listener, {LRef, '_'}}),
  215:     ?TL("reconnect(listen) -> register new transport"),
  216:     true = diameter_reg:add_new({?MODULE, Ref, LRef}),
  217: 
  218:     %% Wait for partner to request transport death.
  219:     ?TL("reconnect(listen) -> abort: await (request for) transport death"),
  220:     TPid = abort(SvcName, LRef, Ref),
  221: 
  222:     %% Kill transport to force the peer to reconnect.
  223:     ?TL("reconnect(listen) -> kill transport"),
  224:     exit(TPid, kill),
  225: 
  226:     %% Wait for the partner again.
  227:     ?TL("reconnect(listen) -> abort: wait for partner again"),
  228:     Res = abort(SvcName, LRef, Ref),
  229: 
  230:     ?TL("reconnect(listen) -> stop event logger"),
  231:     ?DEL_STOP(Logger),
  232: 
  233:     ?TL("reconnect(listen) -> done when"
  234:         "~n   Res: ~p", [Res]),
  235:     ok;
  236: 
  237: reconnect({connect, Ref}) ->
  238:     ?TL("reconnect(connect) -> entry with"
  239:         "~n   Ref: ~p", [Ref]),
  240: 
  241:     SvcName = make_ref(),
  242:     ?TL("reconnect(connect) -> start event logger"),
  243:     Logger = ?DEL_START("reconnect(connect)", SvcName),
  244:     ?TL("reconnect(connect) -> subscribe to service ~p", [SvcName]),
  245:     true = diameter:subscribe(SvcName),
  246:     ?TL("reconnect(connect) -> start service ~p", [SvcName]),
  247:     ok = start_service(SvcName),
  248:     ?TL("reconnect(connect) -> wait when"
  249:         "~n   Svc transports:  ~p"
  250:         "~n   Svc connections: ~p",
  251:         [diameter:service_info(SvcName, transport),
  252:          diameter:service_info(SvcName, connections)]),
  253:     [{{_, _, LRef}, Pid}] = diameter_reg:wait({?MODULE, Ref, '_'}),
  254:     ?TL("reconnect(connect) -> connect when"
  255:         "~n   Svc transports:  ~p"
  256:         "~n   Svc connections: ~p",
  257:         [diameter:service_info(SvcName, transport),
  258:          diameter:service_info(SvcName, connections)]),
  259:     CRef = ?CONNECT(SvcName, tcp, LRef, [{connect_timer, 2000},
  260:                                          {watchdog_timer, 6000}]),
  261:     ?TL("reconnect(connect) -> connected when"
  262:         "~n   Svc transports:  ~p"
  263:         "~n   Svc connections: ~p",
  264:         [diameter:service_info(SvcName, transport),
  265:          diameter:service_info(SvcName, connections)]),
  266: 
  267:     %% Tell partner to kill transport after seeing that there are no
  268:     %% reconnection attempts.
  269:     ?TL("reconnect(connect) -> abort (kill transport)"),
  270:     abort(SvcName, Pid, Ref),
  271: 
  272:     %% Transport goes down and is reestablished.
  273:     ?TL("reconnect(connect) -> await transport down"),
  274:     ?RECV(#diameter_event{service = SvcName, info = {down, CRef, _, _}}),
  275:     ?TL("reconnect(connect) -> await transport reconnect"),
  276:     ?RECV(#diameter_event{service = SvcName, info = {reconnect, CRef, _}}),
  277:     ?TL("reconnect(connect) -> await transport up"),
  278:     ?RECV(#diameter_event{service = SvcName, info = {up, CRef, _, _, _}}),
  279: 
  280:     %% Kill again.
  281:     ?TL("reconnect(connect) -> abort (kill transport again)"),
  282:     abort(SvcName, Pid, Ref),
  283: 
  284:     %% Wait for partner to die.
  285:     ?TL("reconnect(connect) -> await partner death"),
  286:     MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Pid),
  287:     Res = ?RECV({'DOWN', MRef, process, _, _}),
  288: 
  289:     ?TL("reconnect(connect) -> stop event logger"),
  290:     ?DEL_STOP(Logger),
  291: 
  292:     ?TL("reconnect(connect) -> done when"
  293:         "~n   Res: ~p", [Res]),
  294:     ok;
  295: 
  296: reconnect(Prot) ->
  297:     ?TL("reconnect -> entry with"
  298:         "~n   Prot: ~p", [Prot]),
  299:     Ref = make_ref(),
  300:     Res = ?RUN([{{?MODULE, [reconnect, {T, Ref}]}, 240000}
  301:                 || Prot == tcp,  %% ignore sctp
  302:                    T <- [listen, connect]]),
  303: 
  304:     ?TL("reconnect -> done when"
  305:         "~n   Res: ~p", [Res]),
  306:     ok.
  307: 
  308: 
  309: start_service(SvcName) ->
  310:     OH = diameter_util:unique_string(),
  311:     Opts = [{application, [{dictionary, diameter_gen_base_rfc6733},
  312:                            {module, diameter_callback}]},
  313:             {'Origin-Host', OH},
  314:             {'Origin-Realm', OH ++ ".org"},
  315:             {'Vendor-Id', 0},
  316:             {'Product-Name', "x"},
  317:             {'Auth-Application-Id', [0]}],
  318:     diameter:start_service(SvcName, Opts).
  319: 
  320: abort(SvcName, Pid, Ref)
  321:   when is_pid(Pid) ->
  322:     receive
  323:         #diameter_event{service = SvcName, info = {reconnect, _, _}} = E ->
  324:             erlang:error(E)
  325:     after 45000 ->
  326:             ok
  327:     end,
  328:     Pid ! {abort, Ref};
  329: 
  330: abort(SvcName, LRef, Ref)
  331:   when is_reference(LRef) ->
  332:     ?RECV({abort, Ref}),
  333:     [[{ref, LRef}, {type, listen}, {options, _}, {accept, [_,_] = Ts} | _]]
  334:                                                  %% assert on two accepting
  335:         = diameter:service_info(SvcName, transport),
  336:     [TPid] = [P || [{watchdog, {_,_,okay}}, {peer, {P,_}} | _] <- Ts],
  337:     TPid.
  338: 
  339: %% ===========================================================================
  340: %% ===========================================================================
  341: 
  342: %% init/2
  343: 
  344: init(accept, {Prot, Ref}) ->
  345:     ?TL("init(accept) -> entry with"
  346:         "~n   Prot: ~p"
  347:         "~n   Ref:  ~p", [Prot, Ref]),
  348: 
  349:     %% Start an accepting transport and receive notification of a
  350:     %% connection.
  351:     TPid = start_accept(Prot, Ref),
  352: 
  353:     %% Receive a message and send it back.
  354:     <<_:8, Len:24, _/binary>> = Bin = bin(Prot, ?RECV(?TMSG({recv, P}), P)),
  355: 
  356:     Len = size(Bin),
  357:     TPid ! ?TMSG({send, Bin}),
  358: 
  359:     %% Expect the transport process to die as a result of the peer
  360:     %% closing the connection.
  361:     MRef = erlang:monitor(process, TPid),
  362:     Res = ?RECV({'DOWN', MRef, process, _, _}),
  363: 
  364:     ?TL("init(accept) -> done when"
  365:         "~n   Res: ~p", [Res]),
  366:     ok;
  367: 
  368: init(gen_connect, {Prot, Ref}) ->
  369:     ?TL("init(gen_connect) -> entry with"
  370:         "~n   Prot: ~p"
  371:         "~n   Ref:  ~p", [Prot, Ref]),
  372: 
  373:     %% Lookup the peer's listening socket.
  374:     [PortNr] = ?LPORT(Prot, Ref),
  375: 
  376:     %% Connect, send a message and receive it back.
  377:     {ok, Sock} = gen_connect(Prot, PortNr),
  378:     Bin = make_msg(),
  379:     ok = gen_send(Prot, Sock, Bin),
  380:     Bin = gen_recv(Prot, Sock),
  381: 
  382:     ?TL("init(gen_connect) -> done"),
  383:     ok;
  384: 
  385: init(gen_accept, {Prot, Ref}) ->
  386:     ?TL("init(gen_accept) -> entry with"
  387:         "~n   Prot: ~p"
  388:         "~n   Ref:  ~p", [Prot, Ref]),
  389: 
  390:     %% Open a listening socket and publish the port number.
  391:     {ok, LSock} = gen_listen(Prot),
  392:     {ok, PortNr} = inet:port(LSock),
  393:     true = diameter_reg:add_new(?TEST_LISTENER(Ref, PortNr)),
  394: 
  395:     %% Accept a connection, receive a message send it back, and wait
  396:     %% for the peer to close the connection.
  397:     {ok, Sock} = gen_accept(Prot, LSock),
  398:     Bin = gen_recv(Prot, Sock),
  399:     ok = gen_send(Prot, Sock, Bin),
  400:     _Res = receive
  401:                {tcp_closed, Sock} = T ->
  402:                    T;
  403:                ?SCTP(Sock, {_, #sctp_assoc_change{}}) = T ->
  404:                    T
  405:            end,
  406: 
  407:     ?TL("init(gen_accept) -> done when"
  408:         "~n   Res: ~p", [_Res]),
  409:     ok;
  410: 
  411: init(connect, {Prot, Ref}) ->
  412:     ?TL("init(connect) -> entry with"
  413:         "~n   Prot: ~p"
  414:         "~n   Ref:  ~p", [Prot, Ref]),
  415: 
  416:     %% Lookup the peer's listening socket.
  417:     [{?TEST_LISTENER(_, PortNr), _}]
  418:         = diameter_reg:wait(?TEST_LISTENER(Ref, '_')),
  419: 
  420:     %% Start a connecting transport and receive notification of
  421:     %% the connection.
  422:     TPid = start_connect(Prot, PortNr, Ref),
  423: 
  424:     %% Send a message and receive it back.
  425:     Bin = make_msg(),
  426:     TPid ! ?TMSG({send, Bin}),
  427:     Bin = bin(Prot, ?RECV(?TMSG({recv, P}), P)),
  428: 
  429:     ?TL("init(connect) -> done"),
  430:     ok.
  431: 
  432: bin(sctp, #diameter_packet{bin = Bin}) ->
  433:     Bin;
  434: bin(tcp, Bin) ->
  435:     Bin.
  436: 
  437: %% make_msg/0
  438: %%
  439: %% A valid Diameter message in as far as diameter_tcp examines it,
  440: %% the module examining the length in the Diameter header to locate
  441: %% message boundaries.
  442: 
  443: make_msg() ->
  444:     N = 1024,
  445:     Bin = rand_bytes(4*N),
  446:     Len = 4*(N+1),
  447:     <<1:8, Len:24, Bin/binary>>.
  448: 
  449: %% crypto:rand_bytes/1 isn't available on all platforms (since openssl
  450: %% isn't) so roll our own. Not particularly random, but less verbose
  451: %% in trace.
  452: rand_bytes(N) ->
  453:     Oct = rand:uniform(256) - 1,
  454:     binary:copy(<<Oct>>, N).
  455: 
  456: %% ===========================================================================
  457: 
  458: %% start_connect/3
  459: 
  460: start_connect(Prot, PortNr, Ref) ->
  461:     {ok, TPid} = start_connect(Prot,
  462:                                {connect, Ref},
  463:                                ?SVC([]),
  464:                                [{raddr, ?ADDR},
  465:                                 {rport, PortNr},
  466:                                 {ip, ?ADDR},
  467:                                 {port, 0}]),
  468:     connected(Prot, TPid),
  469:     TPid.
  470: 
  471: connected(sctp, TPid) ->
  472:     ?RECV(?TMSG({TPid, connected, _}));
  473: connected(tcp, TPid) ->
  474:     ?RECV(?TMSG({TPid, connected, _, [?ADDR]})).
  475: 
  476: start_connect(sctp, T, Svc, Opts) ->
  477:     {ok, TPid, [?ADDR]}
  478:         = diameter_sctp:start(T, Svc, [{sctp_initmsg, ?SCTP_INIT} | Opts]),
  479:     {ok, TPid};
  480: start_connect(tcp, T, Svc, Opts) ->
  481:     diameter_tcp:start(T, Svc, Opts).
  482: 
  483: %% start_accept/2
  484: 
  485: start_accept(Prot, Ref) ->
  486:     {ok, TPid, [?ADDR]}
  487:         = start_accept(Prot, {accept, Ref}, ?SVC([?ADDR]), [{port, 0}]),
  488:     ?RECV(?TMSG({TPid, connected})),
  489:     TPid.
  490: 
  491: start_accept(sctp, T, Svc, Opts) ->
  492:     diameter_sctp:start(T, Svc, [{sctp_initmsg, ?SCTP_INIT} | Opts]);
  493: start_accept(tcp, T, Svc, Opts) ->
  494:     diameter_tcp:start(T, Svc, Opts).
  495: 
  496: %% ===========================================================================
  497: 
  498: %% gen_connect/2
  499: 
  500: gen_connect(sctp = P, PortNr) ->
  501:     {ok, Sock} = Ok = gen_sctp:open([{ip, ?ADDR}, {port, 0} | ?SCTP_OPTS]),
  502:     ok = gen_sctp:connect_init(Sock, ?ADDR, PortNr, []),
  503:     Ok = gen_accept(P, Sock);
  504: gen_connect(tcp, PortNr) ->
  505:     gen_tcp:connect(?ADDR, PortNr, ?TCP_OPTS).
  506: 
  507: %% gen_listen/1
  508: 
  509: gen_listen(sctp) ->
  510:     {ok, Sock} = gen_sctp:open([{ip, ?ADDR}, {port, 0} | ?SCTP_OPTS]),
  511:     {gen_sctp:listen(Sock, true), Sock};
  512: gen_listen(tcp) ->
  513:     gen_tcp:listen(0, [{ip, ?ADDR} | ?TCP_OPTS]).
  514: 
  515: %% gen_accept/2
  516: 
  517: gen_accept(sctp, Sock) ->
  518:     #sctp_assoc_change{state = comm_up,
  519:                        outbound_streams = OS,
  520:                        inbound_streams = IS,
  521:                        assoc_id = Id}
  522:         = ?RECV(?SCTP(Sock, {_, #sctp_assoc_change{} = S}), S),
  523: 
  524:     putr(assoc, {OS, IS, Id}),
  525:     {ok, Sock};
  526: gen_accept(tcp, LSock) ->
  527:     gen_tcp:accept(LSock).
  528: 
  529: %% gen_send/3
  530: 
  531: gen_send(sctp, Sock, Bin) ->
  532:     {OS, _IS, Id} = getr(assoc),
  533:     case gen_sctp:send(Sock, Id, erlang:unique_integer([positive]) rem OS, Bin) of
  534:         ok ->
  535:             ok;
  536:         {error, Reason} = ERROR ->
  537:             Info = try inet:info(Sock) of
  538:                        I ->
  539:                            I
  540:                    catch
  541:                        C:E:S ->
  542:                            [{class,  C},
  543:                             {error,  E},
  544:                             {stack,  S}]
  545:                    end,
  546:             ?TL("Failed (sctp) sending message: "
  547:                 "~n   Reason:        ~p"
  548:                 "~n   Socket:        ~p"
  549:                 "~n   (Socket) Info: ~p", [Reason, Sock, Info]),
  550:             ERROR
  551:     end;
  552: gen_send(tcp, Sock, Bin) ->
  553:     case gen_tcp:send(Sock, Bin) of
  554:         ok ->
  555:             ok;
  556:         {error, Reason} = ERROR ->
  557:             Info = try inet:info(Sock) of
  558:                        I ->
  559:                            I
  560:                    catch
  561:                        C:E:S ->
  562:                            [{class,  C},
  563:                             {error,  E},
  564:                             {stack,  S}]
  565:                    end,
  566:             ?TL("Failed (tcp) sending message: "
  567:                 "~n   Reason:        ~p"
  568:                 "~n   Socket:        ~p"
  569:                 "~n   (Socket) Info: ~p", [Reason, Sock, Info]),
  570:             ERROR
  571:     end.
  572: 
  573: %% gen_recv/2
  574: 
  575: gen_recv(sctp, Sock) ->
  576:     {OS, IS, Id} = getr(assoc),
  577:     receive
  578:         ?SCTP(Sock, {[#sctp_sndrcvinfo{assoc_id = I} = INFO], Bin})
  579:           when is_binary(Bin) ->
  580:             case {I, Id} of
  581:                 {Id, _} -> % assert
  582:                     Bin;
  583:                 _ ->
  584:                     ?TL("unexpected assoc id in received info msg:"
  585:                         "~n   Expected Assoc ID: ~p"
  586:                         "~n      OS: ~p"
  587:                         "~n      IS: ~p"
  588:                         "~n   Received Assoc ID: ~p"
  589:                         "~n   Info:              ~p", [Id, OS, IS, I, INFO]),
  590:                     ct:fail({unexpected_assoc_id, I, Id})
  591:             end
  592:     end;
  593: gen_recv(tcp, Sock) ->
  594:     tcp_recv(Sock, <<>>).
  595: 
  596: tcp_recv(_, <<_:8, Len:24, _/binary>> = Bin)
  597:   when Len =< size(Bin) ->
  598:     Bin;
  599: tcp_recv(Sock, B) ->
  600:     receive {tcp, Sock, Bin} -> tcp_recv(Sock, <<B/binary, Bin/binary>>) end.
  601: 
  602: %% putr/2
  603: 
  604: putr(Key, Val) ->
  605:     put({?MODULE, Key}, Val).
  606: 
  607: %% getr/1
  608: 
  609: getr(Key) ->
  610:     get({?MODULE, Key}).
